{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2016}}{{Use British English|date=August 2016}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Bradley Collins |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Bradley Ray Collins{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/465277|title=Squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed|date=1 September 2017|accessdate=25 November 2017|publisher=Premier League}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|2|18|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Southampton]], England |height = 1.84m{{cite web |title=Bradley Collins |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/bradley-collins-253781/|work=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=25 November 2017}} |position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] |currentclub = [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) |clubnumber = 40 |youthyears1 = 2010–2017 |youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |years1 = 2017– |clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |caps1 = 0 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2017–2018 |clubs2 = → [[Forest Green Rovers F.C.|Forest Green Rovers]] (loan) |caps2 = 39 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2018– |clubs3 = → [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] (loan) |caps3 = 23 |goals3 = 0 |club-update = 09:17, 3 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Bradley Ray Collins''' (born 18 February 1997) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]], on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]]. ==Career== Born in [[Southampton]], Collins joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2010 at under-12 level, and signed a scholarship in the summer of 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/on-loan-players/bradley-collins.html|title=Profile|accessdate=1 November 2017|publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}{{cite web|url=https://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/chelsea-fc-transfer-rumours-news/2017/7/7/15934738/chelsea-academy-goalkeeper-bradley-collins-forest-green-rovers-loan|title=Chelsea Academy goalkeeper to spend the season in League Two|date=7 July 2017|accessdate=25 November 2017|publisher=SB Nation}} He turned professional in 2014.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea/11482537/Who-are-Chelsea-FA-Youth-Cup-wonderkids.html|title=Who are Chelsea's FA Youth Cup wonderkids?|date=27 April 2015|accessdate=1 November 2017|publisher=The Telegraph}} He was the under-18 first-choice goalkeeper for the 2014–15 season, winning the UEFA Youth League and FA Youth Cup. He was the under-19 and under-21 first-choice for the 2015–16 season. In July 2016 he signed a new contract with the club, until June 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/07/new-contracts-for-academy-duo.html|title=New contracts for Academy duo|date=1 July 2016|accessdate=1 November 2017|publisher=Chelsea F.C.}} In July 2017 he signed a season-long loan deal with [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Forest Green Rovers F.C.|Forest Green Rovers]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40536581|title=Bradley Collins: Forest Green Rovers sign Chelsea goalkeeper on loan|date=7 July 2017|accessdate=11 July 2017|publisher=BBC Sport}} He made his senior professional debut on 5 August 2017, in a league game against [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] which ended in a 2–2 draw. On 31 August 2018, Collins joined [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] on loan until January 2019.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45369424|title=Brad Collins: Chelsea goalkeeper joins Burton Albion on loan until January|date=31 August 2018|accessdate=31 August 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}{{cite web|url=https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/burton-albion-sign-chelsea-goalkeeper-1955735|title=Burton Albion sign Chelsea goalkeeper Bradley Collins on loan|date=31 August 2018|accessdate=10 January 2019|author=Richard Cusack|publisher=Derby Telegraph}} In December 2018, after 10 appearances, he stated he wished to extend his stay,{{cite web|url=https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/chelseas-bradley-collins-extending-loan-2337137|title=Chelsea's Bradley Collins on extending his loan spell with Burton Albion|date=17 December 2018|accessdate=10 January 2019|author=Josh Murray|publisher=Derby Telegraph}} and in January 2019 the loan was extended until the end of the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46749192|title=Brad Collins: Chelsea keeper extends Burton loan stay|date=3 January 2019|accessdate=10 January 2019|publisher=BBC Sport}} ==Career
